thread.title: Arsenal FC news: Man United legend Roy Keane rips into Arsenal flops after Bayern Munich defeat | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal FC news: Man United legend Roy Keane rips into Arsenal flops after Bayern Munich defeat | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal FC news: Man United legend Roy Keane rips into Arsenal flops after Bayern Munich defeat | Metro News
text:
Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 11:34 pm Arsenal suffered a 5-1 defeat against Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) 
Roy Keane insists Arsenal are desperately short of leaders after suffering a humbling defeat at Bayern Munich in the Champions League. 
Arsene Wenger’s side held their own for 45 minutes at the Allianz Arena but eventually succumbed to a devastating 5-1 loss as Bayern took full control of the tie. Paul Scholes admits he based his game on Real Madrid superstar 
The Gunners began to fall apart after captain Laurent Koscielny hobbled off with an injury, handing the armband over to Kieran Gibbs. 
Keane, who won seven Premier League titles with United as a player, believes Gibbs being given the captaincy is symptomatic of the problems Arsenal face. 
‘You need to be organised at the back. When you’re 2 or 3-1 down, you need to take your medicine and stay in the game,’ the Manchester United legend told ITV Football. 
‘When I see Gibbs with the armband on at the end of the game, you’re in big trouble. Keane on lack of leaders at Arsenal "When I see Gibbs with the armband on at the end of the game, you're in trouble" https://t.co/rtHLMtAFpP
